questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'major'?
questions.explanation: Major means greater or more important; 'minor' means lesser in importance.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'present' (as a verb, to show)?
questions.explanation: To present something is to show it; 'conceal' means to hide it.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'steady'?
questions.explanation: Steady means consistent and firm; 'uneven' means not steady or not level.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'brave'?
questions.explanation: Brave means showing courage; 'timid' means shy or lacking courage.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'rapid'?
questions.explanation: Rapid means fast; 'slow' is its direct opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'accept'?
questions.explanation: Accept vs 'refuse' is a strong, clear antonym pair used frequently in tests.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'justice'?
questions.explanation: Justice means fairness; 'injustice' means lack of fairness.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'patient'?
questions.explanation: Patient means able to wait calmly; 'restless' means unable to relax or wait.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'increase'?
questions.explanation: Increase means go up; 'reduce' means bring down.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'thick'?
questions.explanation: Thick vs 'thin' is the basic antonym pair for density or width.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'enter'?
questions.explanation: Enter means go in; 'exit' means go out.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'maximum'?
questions.explanation: Maximum is the greatest amount; 'minimum' is the least.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'calm'?
questions.explanation: Calm means peaceful; 'agitated' means disturbed or emotionally upset.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'occupied'?
questions.explanation: Occupied means being used; 'empty' means not in use or containing nothing.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'mature'?
questions.explanation: Mature means fully developed; 'immature' means not fully developed.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'amplify'?
questions.explanation: Amplify means increase or make stronger; 'diminish' means make weaker or smaller.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'gain'?
questions.explanation: Gain vs 'lose' is a classic antonym pair used frequently in test questions.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'focus'?
questions.explanation: To focus is to concentrate attention; 'distract' is to pull attention away.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'cheerful'?
questions.explanation: Cheerful means happy; 'gloomy' means sad or depressed in mood.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'ancient'?
questions.explanation: Ancient means very old; 'modern' means related to the present or recent times.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'complicated'?
questions.explanation: Complicated means complex; 'simple' is the direct opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'rapid'?
questions.explanation: Rapid means fast; 'slow' is its simplest antonym.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'empty'?
questions.explanation: Empty vs 'full' is the standard basic antonym pair used in vocab tests.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'faint'?
questions.explanation: Faint (as in light or color) means weak; 'bright' means strong and vivid.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'comply'?
questions.explanation: Comply means follow a rule or request; 'resist' means act against it.
